definitions: To provide a computer or other machine with coded instructions for the automatic performance of a particular task.
To arrange for an event or activity to happen at a particular time or to be included in a particular scheme.
To cause (a person or animal) to behave in a particular way according to a set of instructions or a pattern.
examples: She will programme the robot to assemble the parts.
The concert was programmed for next Tuesday.
The children were programmed to respond to the bell.
